legislation.name: Federal WARN Act (Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act)

rules.source_text: 29 U.S.C. § 2101(a)(3) & § 2102(a): A mass layoff requires notice when 50+ employees are affected AND they comprise at least 33% of active employees at the site. Alternatively, 500+ employees affected triggers notice regardless of percentage. Employer must have 100+ full-time employees (excluding part-time).
29 U.S.C. § 2101(a)(3)(B): A mass layoff also means a reduction in force of 500 or more employees at a single site of employment, regardless of percentage of workforce.

parameters.recipient: State dislocated worker unit and local government

rules.source_text: 29 U.S.C. § 2102(a)(2): The employer shall serve written notice to the State or entity designated by the State to carry out rapid response activities and the chief elected official of the unit of local government within which such closing or layoff is to occur.

29 U.S.C. § 2104(a)(1): Any employer who orders a plant closing or mass layoff in violation of section 2102 shall be liable to each aggrieved employee who suffers an employment loss for back pay for each day of violation and benefits under an employee benefit plan.
